trans-unit.source: Constraints that have been solved by the plugin must be provided with evidence in the form of an EvTerm of the type of the constraint. This evidence is ignored for given and derived constraints, which GHC “solves” simply by discarding them; typically this is used when they are uninformative (e.g. reflexive equations). For wanted constraints, the evidence will form part of the Core term that is generated after typechecking, and can be checked by -dcore-lint. It is possible for the plugin to create equality axioms for use in evidence terms, but GHC does not check their consistency, and inconsistent axiom sets may lead to segfaults or other runtime misbehaviour.
trans-unit.target: 插件已解决的约束必须以约束类型的 EvTerm 形式提供证据。对于给定的和派生的约束，该证据将被忽略，GHC只是通过丢弃它们来“解决”。通常，当它们没有信息时（例如自反方程式），将使用此方法。对于所需的约束，证据将构成类型检查后生成的核心术语的一部分，并且可以由 -dcore-lint 检查。插件有可能创建用于证明的相等公理，但GHC不会检查其一致性，并且公理集不一致可能会导致段错误或其他运行时异常。

trans-unit.source: Control whether the RTS behaviour can be tweaked via command-line flags and the GHCRTS environment variable. Using none means no RTS flags can be given; some means only a minimum of safe options can be given (the default); all (or no argument at all) means that all RTS flags are permitted; ignore means RTS flags can be given, but are treated as regular arguments and passed to the Haskell program as arguments; ignoreAll is the same as ignore, but GHCRTS is also ignored. -rtsopts does not affect -with-rtsopts behavior; flags passed via -with-rtsopts are used regardless of -rtsopts.
trans-unit.target: 控制是否可以通过命令行标志和 GHCRTS 环境变量来调整RTS行为。使用 none 手段没有RTS标志可以给出; some 意味着只能给出最少的安全选项（默认）； all （或完全没有参数）表示允许所有RTS标志； ignore 表示可以给出RTS标志，但是将其视为常规参数并作为参数传递给Haskell程序； ignoreAll 与 ignore 相同，但是 GHCRTS 也被忽略。 -rtsopts 不会影响 -with-rtsopts 的行为；通过 -with-rtsopts 传递的标志不管 -rtsopts 都使用。

trans-unit.source: Convert a path into an absolute path. If the given path is relative, the current directory is prepended and the path may or may not be simplified. trans-unit.source: Convert a path into an absolute path. If the given path is relative, the current directory is prepended and then the combined result is normalized. If the path is already absolute, the path is simply normalized. The function preserves the presence or absence of the trailing path separator unless the path refers to the root directory /.
trans-unit.target: 将路径转换为绝对路径。如果给定路径是相对路径，则在当前目录前添加前缀，然后将合并结果标准化。如果路径已经是绝对路径，则只需对路径进行规范化即可。该函数保留尾随路径分隔符的存在或不存在，除非路径指向根目录 / 。

trans-unit.source: Convert to ISO 8601 Week Date format. First element of result is year, second week number (1-53), third day of week (1 for Monday to 7 for Sunday). Note that "Week" years are not quite the same as Gregorian years, as the first day of the year is always a Monday. The first week of a year is the first week to contain at least four days in the corresponding Gregorian year.

trans-unit.source: Correctly instrumented code provides coverage information of two kinds: source coverage and boolean-control coverage. Source coverage is the extent to which every part of the program was used, measured at three different levels: declarations (both top-level and local), alternatives (among several equations or case branches) and expressions (at every level). Boolean coverage is the extent to which each of the values True and False is obtained in every syntactic boolean context (ie. guard, condition, qualifier).
trans-unit.target: 正确的工具化代码提供了两种覆盖率信息:源覆盖率和布尔控制覆盖率。源头覆盖率是指程序的每个部分被使用的程度,从三个不同的层次来衡量:声明(包括顶层和局部)、备选方案(在几个方程或案例分支中)和表达式(在每个层次上)。布尔覆盖率是指在每一个语法布尔上下文(即守备、条件、限定符)中获得True和False两个值的程度。

trans-unit.source: DEPRECATED. Get the number of bytes of remaining input. Note that this is an expensive function to use as in order to calculate how much input remains, all input has to be read and kept in-memory. The decoder keeps the input as a strict bytestring, so you are likely better off by calculating the remaining input in another way.
trans-unit.target: 已取消。获取剩余输入的字节数。请注意,这是一个昂贵的函数,因为为了计算剩余的输入量,所有的输入都必须被读取并保存在内存中。解码器将输入保存为一个严格的字节串,所以你最好用其他方式计算剩余的输入。

trans-unit.source: DEPRECATED. Provides compatibility with previous versions of this library. Run a Get monad and return a tuple with three values. The first value is the result of the decoder. The second and third are the unused input, and the number of consumed bytes.

trans-unit.source: DLLs on Windows are typically linked to by linking to a corresponding .lib or .dll.a — the so-called import library. GHC will typically generate such a file for every DLL you create by compiling in -shared mode. However, sometimes you don’t want to pay the disk-space cost of creating this import library, which can be substantial — it might require as much space as the code itself, as Haskell DLLs tend to export lots of symbols.
trans-unit.target: Windows上的DLL通常通过链接到相应的 .lib 或 .dll.a （即所谓的导入库）来链接。GHC通常会以 -shared 模式编译时为您创建的每个DLL生成此类文件。但是，有时您不想支付创建此导入库的磁盘空间成本，这可能是巨大的—它可能需要与代码本身一样多的空间，因为Haskell DLL往往会导出大量符号。

trans-unit.source: Data and newtype instance declarations are only permitted when an appropriate family declaration is in scope - just as a class instance declaration requires the class declaration to be visible. Moreover, each instance declaration has to conform to the kind determined by its family declaration. This implies that the number of parameters of an instance declaration matches the arity determined by the kind of the family.
trans-unit.target: 只有当适当的族声明在范围内时,才允许进行数据和新类型实例声明--就像类实例声明需要类声明可见一样。此外,每个实例声明必须符合其族声明所确定的种类。这意味着实例声明的参数数要与族声明的种类所决定的性数相匹配。

trans-unit.source: Data families appear in two flavours: (1) they can be defined on the toplevel or (2) they can appear inside type classes (in which case they are known as associated types). The former is the more general variant, as it lacks the requirement for the type-indexes to coincide with the class parameters. However, the latter can lead to more clearly structured code and compiler warnings if some type instances were - possibly accidentally - omitted. In the following, we always discuss the general toplevel form first and then cover the additional constraints placed on associated types.
trans-unit.target: 数据族以两种形式出现。(1)它们可以在toplevel上定义,或(2)它们可以出现在类型类中(在这种情况下,它们被称为关联类型)。前者是更普遍的变体,因为它没有类型索引与类参数一致的要求。然而,如果一些类型实例被--可能是意外地--省略了,后者会导致更清晰的结构化代码和编译器警告。在下文中,我们总是先讨论一般的toplevel形式,然后再讨论放在关联类型上的附加约束。

trans-unit.source: Data families are tricky territory. Their headers are exempt from this rule, but their instances are not:
Data family instance constructors cannot be promoted at the moment. GHC’s type theory just isn’t up to the task of promoting data families, which requires full dependent types.

trans-unit.source: Datatype-generic functions are based on the idea of converting values of a datatype T into corresponding values of a (nearly) isomorphic type Rep T. The type Rep T is built from a limited set of type constructors, all provided by this module. A datatype-generic function is then an overloaded function with instances for most of these type constructors, together with a wrapper that performs the mapping between T and Rep T. By using this technique, we merely need a few generic instances in order to implement functionality that works for any representable type.
trans-unit.target: 数据类型通用函数基于将数据类型 T 的值转换为（几乎）同构类型 Rep T 的相应值的思想。 Rep T 类型是由一组有限的类型构造函数构建的，而这些构造函数均由此模块提供。然后，数据类型通用函数是一个重载函数，其中包含大多数这些类型构造函数的实例，以及执行 T 和 Rep T 之间映射的包装器。通过使用此技术，我们只需几个通用实例即可实现适用于任何可表示类型的功能。

trans-unit.source: Datatype-generic functions as defined above work for a large class of datatypes, including parameterized datatypes. (We have used Tree as our example above, which is of kind * -> *.) However, the Generic class ranges over types of kind *, and therefore, the resulting generic functions (such as encode) must be parameterized by a generic type argument of kind *.
trans-unit.target: 上面定义的通用数据类型函数可用于一大类数据类型，包括参数化数据类型。（我们在上面的示例中使用 Tree 为 * -> * 类型的树。）然而， Generic 类覆盖了 * 类型的类型，因此，生成的泛型函数（例如 encode ）必须由泛型进行参数化类型 * 的类型参数。

trans-unit.source: Debug messages will be sent to the binary event log file instead of stdout if the -l ⟨flags⟩ option is added. This might be useful for reducing the overhead of debug tracing.
Debug messages will be sent to the binary event log file instead of stdout if the -l option is added. This might be useful for reducing the overhead of debug tracing.
trans-unit.target: 如果添加了 -l 选项，则调试消息将发送到二进制事件日志文件，而不是stdout 。这对于减少调试跟踪的开销可能很有用。

trans-unit.source: Debugging output is in one of several “styles.” Take the printing of types, for example. In the “user” style (the default), the compiler’s internal ideas about types are presented in Haskell source-level syntax, insofar as possible. In the “debug” style (which is the default for debugging output), the types are printed in with explicit foralls, and variables have their unique-id attached (so you can check for things that look the same but aren’t). This flag makes debugging output appear in the more verbose debug style.
trans-unit.target: 调试输出采用几种“样式”之一。以打印类型为例。在“用户”风格（默认）下，尽可能以Haskell源代码级语法显示有关类型的编译器内部思想。在“调试”样式中（这是调试输出的默认设置），这些类型以显式的forall打印，变量附加其唯一ID（因此您可以检查外观相同但不同的事物）。该标志使调试输出以更详细的调试样式显示。

trans-unit.source: Decrease the “go-for-it” threshold for unfolding smallish expressions. Give a -funfolding-use-threshold=0 option for the extreme case. (“Only unfoldings with zero cost should proceed.”) Warning: except in certain specialised cases (like Happy parsers) this is likely to actually increase the size of your program, because unfolding generally enables extra simplifying optimisations to be performed.
trans-unit.target: 降低展开小表情的“ go-to-it”阈值。对于极端情况，请提供 -funfolding-use-threshold=0 选项。（“仅应进行零成本的展开。”）警告：除非在某些特殊情况下（如Happy解析器），否则实际上可能会增加程序的大小，因为展开通常会执行额外的简化优化。

trans-unit.source: Defer and group diagnostic messages by severity

Defer as many type errors as possible until runtime. At compile time you get a warning (instead of an error). At runtime, if you use a value that depends on a type error, you get a runtime error; but you can run any type-correct parts of your code just fine. See Deferring type errors to runtime
trans-unit.target: 将尽可能多的类型错误推迟到运行时。在编译时，您会收到警告（而不是错误）。在运行时，如果使用依赖于类型错误的值，则会出现运行时错误；但是您可以运行代码中任何类型正确的部分。请参见将类型错误推迟到运行时

trans-unit.source: Defer typed holes errors (errors about names with a leading underscore (e.g., “_”, “_foo”, “_bar”)) until runtime. This will turn the errors produced by typed holes into warnings. Using a value that depends on a typed hole produces a runtime error, the same as -fdefer-type-errors (which implies this option). See Typed Holes and Deferring type errors to runtime.
trans-unit.target: 延迟键入的空洞错误（有关带下划线的名称错误（例如，“ _”，“ _ foo”，“ _ bar”）），直到运行时为止。这会将键入的孔产生的错误变成警告。使用取决于类型孔的值会产生运行时错误，与 -fdefer-type-errors 相同（表示此选项）。请参见键入孔和将类型错误推迟到运行时。

trans-unit.source: Defer variable out-of-scope errors (errors about names without a leading underscore) until runtime. This will turn variable-out-of-scope errors into warnings. Using a value that depends on an out-of-scope variable produces a runtime error, the same as -fdefer-type-errors (which implies this option). See Typed Holes and Deferring type errors to runtime.
trans-unit.target: 将变量范围外的错误（关于名称不带下划线的错误）推迟到运行时。这会将范围外的错误转变为警告。使用取决于范围外变量的值会产生运行时错误，与 -fdefer-type-errors 相同（表示此选项）。请参见键入孔和将类型错误推迟到运行时。
